1960 & 2016:
"The ____ Seven"

1999:
"The ____ Mr. Ripley"

With Jerry Lewis or Eddie Murphy:
"The ____ Professor"

2 adjectives:
"____ Sunshine of the ____ Mind"

1945 Oscar winner:
"The ____ Weekend"
The bitter native drink chocolatl had sugar added to it by these 16th century conquerors
It might ring a bell that these chocolate cakes from Hostess debuted in 1967
Charlie Bucket is the title character in this 1964 children's book
Originally it meant coffee that came from Yemen; later, it came to mean coffee flavored with chocolate
In addition to its famous square in San Francisco, this chocolatier has ice cream & candy stores in several other cities

rounds.category: THE LONG ARM OF THE LAW

clues.text: In 2014 a U.S. fugitive was nabbed in Nepal after his picture clicked with this "recognition" software
"Affluenza" teen Ethan Couch was busted in Mexico after cops traced a call to this pizza chain (but didn't arrive in 30 min.)
John List was arrested in 1989, 18 years after killing his family, after his age-enhanced image ran on this Fox TV show
Fugitives can run but they can't hide from this 190-member-nation organization founded in 1923
American criminals, don't flee to Sri Lanka; the U.S. &. that country signed this type of agreement Sept. 30, 1999
In 1992 this Italian fashion house launched its more affordable Miu Miu line
The name of this cocktail means "strained pineapple"
This Spanish term for an open porch is also a chain of inns
You can zoom along at 130 kilometers per hour on this Italian motorway
This ancient mountaintop fortress in Israel is the site of the Jews' last stand against the Romans in 70 A.D.
Author Richard Matheson eats egg rolls & notes that he was born in the year of this cat &, fittingly, went to the U. of Missouri
James Madison adds that he was born in the year of the goat, as was the Constitution when it came to be in this year
Nibbling a wonton, Grace Slick says it makes sense she was born in the year of this animal, as she sang about a white one
Pass the soy sauce to this creator of a famous comic strip dog, born in the year of the dog on Nov. 26, 1922
Over tea, he notes he was born in 1800, year of the monkey, & invented vulcanization monkeying around with rubber

rounds.comments: (Alex: You'll phrase each correct response beginning that way.)

clues.text: Navigate Lhotse Face & Geneva Spur; survive Death Zone, reach Hillary Step; planting flag is optional
clues.response: how do you scale Mount Everest

clues.text: Ignore the impulses telling you not to & drop the object into Mount Doom
clues.response: how to destroy the One Ring

clues.text: Season tenderloin, apply mushroom duxelles, wrap meat in puff pastry, then bake
clues.response: How do you make beef Wellington?

clues.text: Slide your feet up the street, bend your back, shift your arm & pull it back, just like the Bangles song says
In the Olympics, grip object with finger joints on outside edge; twirl your body; release object
clues.response: how do you throw the discus

clues.text: Frank Spiering titled his in-depth story of an alleged 1892 double murderer this, just her first name
Piers Paul Read's "Alive" recounts a rugby team surviving a plane crash & resorting to cannibalism in these mountains
Wonder what it's like to be a girl from Seattle accused of murder in Italy? Read her "Waiting to be Heard"
John Steinbeck chronicled his journey across America with his pet poodle in "Travels with" him
Peter Matthiessen's memoir of hiking in the Himalayas has this title, also a rare feline of that region

Muir Woods
Little Bighorn Battlefield
White Sands
Organ Pipe Cactus & Navajo

It means "served raw"
It's Russian for "king"
An indication of a river's height, or an impression on a piece of paper visible in light
The pope's titles have included this "of Christ" & "of St. Peter"

possible suicide by this method

suicide by this method

In this movie a Variety headline says, "Malko ankles screen for strings"
Before he worked with Carrie & Bruno on "Dancing with the Stars", he co-hosted FX' "Breakfast Time" with Bob the Puppet
Matt Damon was a puppet of few words in this 2004 film: "World Police"
Crow & Tom Servo gave their running commentary for "This Island Earth" in a 1996 movie based on this TV show
In the Gospel of John, Jesus calls himself "the good" this who "giveth his life for the sheep"
Someone who has strong, unchangeable opinions is said to be "dyed in" this
A diploma
A black-banded food fish, or a Brooklyn bay
To do this to a Christmas tree, apply a substance to the branches to give the appearance of snow

rounds.text: The New York Times said this late Brit's multi-octave range & operatic quality made "even paeans to bicycle riding sound emotional"
